hanzi-su-wiki:
園

Значения

Сад

Мнемоника

  • Сад с оградой 囗, где гуляет знать, облачившись в кринолин (снизу) до почвы 土. Кринолин есть длинная одежда 衣 с высоким поясом 囗.

  • "Я иду в сад, чтобы танцевать."

Варианты

园, 薗
purpleculture_pinyin:
yuán
land used for growing plants; site used for public recreation; abbr. for a place ending in 园 , such as a botanical garden 植物园 , kindergarten 幼儿园 etc
земля, используемая для выращивания растений; сайт, используемый для общественного отдыха; сокр. для мест, оканчивающихся на 园, таких как ботанический сад 植物园, детский сад 幼儿园 и т. д.

heisig_chinese_memo: A nice picnic pent up in the park, with your crock pot and scarf (picnic blanket).

koohiiStory1: A nice picnic pent up in the park, with your crock pot and scarf (picnic blanket).
koohiiStory2: There was a homeless man living in a box at the park so I gave him a lidded crock filled with hot curry tied with a scarf...

園(えん): garden (esp. man-made)

田園(でんえん): country, rural districts

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You examine the mouth of a zombie and find a small garden in there. There are even benches... it looks like a park.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Zombies are dead, so I guess their mouths have all the things garden plants crave. Their mouths are like compost piles, if you think about it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You look closer at the garden and suddenly everything ends (えん).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Oh. The zombie probably bit down on your head and now it's the end for you. At least you were looking at a nice garden at the end of it all...

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: In the beginning a park is pent in with wooden fences to allow the grass and flowers to grow without people stepping on them
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "囗", " Yuan ", the original meaning is a fenced area where vegetables, fruits, flowers and trees are planted. "Shuowen": "That's why the fruit is also. From the 囗, Yuan Sheng." "Poetry. Zheng Feng. Jiang Zhongzi": "Chang Zhongzi Xi, no more than my garden, without breaking my tree sandalwood." Zhu Xi's collection: " The domain of the gardener's nursery can grow trees." Jin Panyue "Xianju Fu": "Implant porridge and vegetables in the garden for daily meals."

" Garden " is also used as a place for people to rest and enjoy, such as gardens, gardens, and parks. "Li Shi‧ Han Chengyang Order Tang Fusong": "White Dodder Sujiu, tour the Junyuan Garden." "Old Book of Tang Dynasty-Lu Shu Biography": "Shu Shidi has Jialinyuan...the name of the dynasty, A tour of Xiancong." The text on the bamboo slips and silk also includes "Yuanyuyuanchi, the deceit of the people" ("Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips-The Way of Officials" Jan 34-3).

" Garden " also refers to the tomb of the emperor. "Historical Records-Huainan Hengshan Biographies": "The posthumous king of Huainan is the king of Li, and the garden is like a vassal." "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Emperor Guangwu": "Moved to the Queen Mother Lu's Temple Master. Four o'clock worship." Note: "The garden is the domain of the grave."

The place where things gather is also called " garden ". Sima Xiangru of the Han Dynasty "Shanglin Fu": "Curture your body like the "Li" garden, and soar like the "Book" garden." Qing Yaoxie's "High Balcony": "Ten years of Wenyuan, tears filled with tears for no reason."

" Yuan " is also commonly referred to as " round ." "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Japanese Book A Type" Jian 77 back: "The Pirate's Garden (round) noodles, he is also a man of dignity, and he can't do it (Twilight)."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "囗", " Yuan ", the original meaning is a place surrounded by fences for planting vegetables, fruits and flowers.
humanum_full_description:
從「囗」，「袁」聲，本義為四周有圍欄，種植蔬果花木的地方。《說文》：「所以樹果也。从囗，袁聲。」《詩‧鄭風‧將仲子》：「將仲子兮，無踰我園，無折我樹檀。」朱熹集傳：「園者圃之藩，其內可種木也。」晉潘岳〈閑居賦〉：「灌園粥蔬，以供朝夕之膳。」

　　「園」也用作供人休憩、賞樂之地，如花園、庭園、公園。《隸釋‧漢成陽令唐扶頌》：「白菟素鳩，遊君園庭。」《舊唐書‧路恕傳》：「恕私第有佳林園……朝之名卿，咸從之遊。」簡帛文字亦有「苑囿園池，觀民之詐」（《睡虎地秦簡‧為吏之道》簡34-3）。

　　「園」還指帝后陵寢。《史記‧淮南衡山列傳》：「追尊謚淮南王為厲王，置園復如諸侯儀。」《後漢書‧光武帝紀下》：「遷呂太后廟主於圍。四時上祭。」李賢注：「園，謂塋域也。」

　　事物聚集之地也稱作「園」。漢司馬相如〈上林賦〉：「脩容乎《禮》園，翱翔乎《書》圃。」清姚燮〈高陽臺〉：「十載文園，無端淚滿鮫綃。」

　　「園」也通作「圓」。《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡77背：「盜者園（圓）面，其為人也鞞鞞然，夙得莫（暮）不得。」
humanum_short_description: 從「囗」，「袁」聲，本義為四周有圍欄，種植蔬果花木的地方。

①種植果蔬花木的地方：園子。園丁。園藝。園圃。
②原指別墅遊息之所，現指供人遊玩、娛樂的公共場所：圓明園。公園。
③舊指歷代帝王以及親王、妃嬪、公主之墓：園廟(帝王墓地所建之宗廟)。園陵(帝王的墓地)。
園林 [ yuán lín ]: gardens; park; landscape garden

從「 囗 」，「 袁 」聲，本義為四周有圍欄，種植蔬果花木的地方。《說文》：「所以樹果也。从囗，袁聲。」《詩‧鄭風‧將仲子》：「將仲子兮，無踰我園，無折我樹檀。」朱熹集傳：「園者圃之藩，其內可種木也。」晉潘岳〈閑居賦〉：「灌園粥蔬，以供朝夕之膳。」 「 園 」也用作供人休憩、賞樂之地，如花園、庭園、公園。《隸釋‧漢成陽令唐扶頌》：「白菟素鳩，遊君園庭。」《舊唐書‧路恕傳》：「恕私第有佳林園……朝之名卿，咸從之遊。」簡帛文字亦有「苑囿園池，觀民之詐」（《睡虎地秦簡‧為吏之道》簡34-3）。 「 園 」還指帝后陵寢。《史記‧淮南衡山列傳》：「追尊謚淮南王為厲王，置園復如諸侯儀。」《後漢書‧光武帝紀下》：「遷呂太后廟主於圍。四時上祭。」李賢注：「園，謂塋域也。」 事物聚集之地也稱作「 園 」。漢司馬相如〈上林賦〉：「脩容乎《禮》園，翱翔乎《書》圃。」清姚燮〈高陽臺〉：「十載文園，無端淚滿鮫綃。」 「 園 」也通作「 圓 」。《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡77背：「盜者園（圓）面，其為人也鞞鞞然，夙得莫（暮）不得。」
From the sound of " 囗", " Yuan", the original meaning is a fenced area where vegetables, fruits, flowers and trees are planted. "Shuowen": "That's why the fruit is also. From the 囗, Yuan Sheng." "Poetry. Zheng Feng. Jiang Zhongzi": "Chang Zhongzi Xi, no more than my garden, without breaking my tree sandalwood." Zhu Xi's collection: " The domain of the gardener's nursery can grow trees." Jin Panyue "Xianju Fu": "Implant porridge and vegetables in the garden for daily meals." " Garden" is also used as a place for people to rest and enjoy, such as gardens, gardens, and parks. "Li Shi‧ Han Chengyang Order Tang Fusong": "White Dodder Sujiu, tour the Junyuan Garden." "Old Book of Tang Dynasty-Lu Shu Biography": "Shu Shidi has Jialinyuan...the name of the dynasty, A tour of Xiancong." The text on the bamboo slips and silk also includes "Yuanyuyuanchi, the deceit of the people" ("Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips-The Way of Officials" Jan 34-3). " Garden" also refers to the tomb of the emperor. "Historical Records-Huainan Hengshan Biographies": "The posthumous king of Huainan is the king of Li, and the garden is like a vassal." "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Emperor Guangwu": "Moved to the Queen Mother Lu's Temple Master. Four o'clock worship." Note: "The garden is the domain of the grave." The place where things gather is also called " garden". Sima Xiangru of the Han Dynasty "Shanglin Fu": "Curture your body like the "Li" garden, and soar like the "Book" garden." Qing Yaoxie's "High Balcony": "Ten years of Wenyuan, tears filled with tears for no reason." " Yuan" is also commonly referred to as " round." "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Japanese Book A Type" Jian 77 back: "The Pirate's Garden (round) noodles, he is also a man of dignity, and he can't do it (Twilight)."

園字的基本解释

園
yuán
见“园”。

園字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yuán］
［《廣韻》雨元切，平元，云。］
亦作“薗1”。“园2”的繁体字。
(1)四周圈围，种植蔬果花木的地方。
(2)庭园；供人憩息、游乐或观赏的地方。
(3)帝王、后妃的墓地。
(4)事物聚集的地方。
(5)某些行业，如剧院、澡堂、商店、酱菜铺等也称园。

園字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【囗字部】　園； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页220第08
【唐韻】羽元切【集韻】于元切，?音袁。【說文】所以樹果也。【初學記】有藩曰園。【易·賁卦】賁于丘園，束帛戔戔。【詩·鄭風】將仲子兮，無踰我園。【註】園者，圃之樊，其內可樹木也。又【周禮·地官·載師】以場圃任園地。【註】圃，種果蓏之屬。季秋，於其中爲場。樊圃謂之園，任者取正於是也。【又】園廛二十而一。【註】廛無穀，園少利，故僅二十而稅一也。　又歷代帝王陵寢曰園。漢制，園陵有令，文帝陵爲文園。【司馬相如傳】爲文園令。又【唐書·李晟傳】臣已肅淸宮禁，袛謁寢園。　又桃園，地名。【前漢·地理志】全鳩里，其西名桃園，卽古之桃林也。【潘岳·西征賦】問休牛之故林，感徵名於桃園。　又袛園。【梵書】須達多長者，建精舍，請佛住，凡千二百區，謂之祇樹園。又東園公，商山四皓之一。○按史失其姓名，《字彙》以園公爲姓，非。　又叶于羣切，音熅。【蘇軾·祭韓琦文】意廣才疏，將歸丘園。公治此邦，歿食其民。

考證：〔【周禮·地官·充人】以場圃任園地
園字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
園字的起名意思

暂无。

garden
Basic explanation of words
garden
yuán
See "garden".
garden
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yuán］
["Guangyun" Yuyuan cut, Pingyuan, cloud. ]
Also known as "薗1". Traditional characters for "园2".
(1) Surrounded by a place where vegetables, fruits, flowers and trees are planted.
(2) Garden; a place for people to rest, play or watch.
(3) Tombs of emperors and concubines.
(4) A place where things gather.
(5) Certain industries, such as theaters, bathhouses, shops, pickles shops, etc., are also called gardens.
garden
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chou Ji 1] [囗字部] 　 Yuan; Kangxi strokes: 13; page number: page 220 08
[Tang Yun] Yu Yuanqie [Ji Yun] Yu Yuanqie,? Yin Yuan. [Said the text] So the fruit is also. [Beginner's Notes] There is a Fan Yue Garden. [Easy·Ben Hexagram] Ben is in the Qiuyuan, tied with silk and twisted. 【Poetry·Zheng Feng】Coming Zhong Zixi is no more than my garden. [Note] The gardener is the fan of the garden, and there can be trees in it. Also 【Zhou Li·Di Guan·Zhi Shi】Use the field garden as the garden. [Note] The nursery is the genus that grows the fruit of Dioscorea nigra. Season and autumn are among them. Fan Pu is called the garden, and the one whoever takes it is right. [Also] Twenty one in the garden. [Note] There is no valley in the land, and the garden is less profitable, so it is only twenty and the tax is one.　The tombs of the emperors of the past dynasties are called gardens. Han Dynasty, there are orders in the garden, and Emperor Wen's mausoleum is Wenyuan. 【The Legend of Sima Xiangru】is the order of Wenyuan. Also【Tang Shu·Li Sheng Chuan】The minister has been banned from the palace and stayed in the garden.　Taoyuan again, place name. [Pre-Han·Geography] Quanjiuli, whose western name is Taoyuan, is also the ancient Taolin. [Pan Yue·Xi Zheng Fu] Inquiry about the native forest of Xiu Niu, whose name is Taoyuan.　Zhuan Yuan again. [Sanskrit] To the elders, build an abode, invite the Buddha to live, where there are thousands of 200 districts, it is called the only tree garden. Name meaning
Nothing.
yuán
garden; park, orchard

園

Значения

Сад

Мнемоника

  • Сад с оградой 囗, где гуляет знать, облачившись в кринолин (снизу) до почвы 土. Кринолин есть длинная одежда 衣 с высоким поясом 囗.

  • "Я иду в сад, чтобы танцевать."

Варианты

园, 薗

Radicals: 口  (mouth, zombie)
Meaning Mnemonic
You examine the mouth of a zombie and find a small garden in there. There are even benches... it looks like a park.
Zombies are dead, so I guess their mouths have all the things garden plants crave. Their mouths are like compost piles, if you think about it.
Reading Mnemonic
You look closer at the garden and suddenly everything ends (えん).
Oh. The zombie probably bit down on your head and now it's the end for you. At least you were looking at a nice garden at the end of it all...
